channel.title: Xbox 360 Problems
channel.description:
Today, my Xbox 360 has finally packed in after nearly 2 years of faithful service; E74 error. Going to be sending it off to Germany soon for a repair (luckily I'm still in warranty.)
Does anyone here own an Xbox 360 and if so, have you had any problems with it?

item.title: Xbox 360 Problems
item.dc:creator: taxi_evil
item.description:
I don’t have anything like the time or money to upgrade a PC. I don’t even own one, I have a laptop for work (and half-life) and an xbox for me gaming

But Ramirezoid is right, there is a superiority thing going on. I don’t really care what people play on, they’re still gamers

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Problems
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
I have a friend who did the same thing and his xbox is still fine after 3 years of use.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Problems
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
I’ve had my Xbox360 for three years with absolutely no problems encountered.

From what I can gather, red Ring might only happen if you buy an Xbox with all of the extra crap already included. I bought an Arcade in 2007 and stuck a hard drive on it.

I dislike that Gaming PCs come with a superiority complex preinstalled.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Problems
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
Timmeh2k9:

Apparently 343 Industries might be porting it, just like the Hired Gun team did with Halo 2.

Some day the superiority of the PC will be realized by all; most likely when it gets cheaper.

That’s the only good thing about consoles, you don’t have to upgrade- but not because your box is superior in sepcs, only because the developers dumb down their games so they’ll run without major upgrades.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Problems
item.dc:creator: Timmeh2k9
item.description:
SURPLUS_NiNjA:

Yes in the future, by the time Halo 6 is out on Xbox. Typically all 360 exclusive titles come out on PC but a lot of the time its delayed. Also some games you just have to play on Xbox. Also I noticed that exclusives games like that have a lower player population then normal PC games.

Apparently 343 Industries might be porting it, just like the Hired Gun team did with Halo 2.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Problems
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
Timmeh2k9:

If you’re thinking about Halo 3 for example, I hear rumors that it is going to be ported to the PC in the future.

Yes in the future, by the time Halo 6 is out on Xbox. Typically all 360 exclusive titles come out on PC but a lot of the time its delayed. Also some games you just have to play on Xbox. Also I noticed that exclusives games like that have a lower player population then normal PC games.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Problems
item.dc:creator: Timmeh2k9
item.description:
shram:

Now isn’t the future :’(
I like my xbox for the simplicity, just pop a game in and play.
the pc is also good for gaming but… not as easy to just pop and play, especially with my pc xD

I would use my PC more but my HDD is a SATA 120gb Maxtor. I NEED A NEW ONE! :fffuuu:

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Problems
item.dc:creator: Timmeh2k9
item.description:
Schizophriend:

I went through 5 360s. All RRoD.

I hate exclusive titles. I would have switch to PC a long time ago otherwise.

If you’re thinking about Halo 3 for example, I hear rumors that it is going to be ported to the PC in the future.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Problems
item.dc:creator: Timmeh2k9
item.description:
I will be honest in saying I prefer my PC when it comes to playing games, but I can’t be assed to continue upgrading it all the time. I got an 8800gts 320mb GFX Card back when it was new, good at the time but it’s starting to show age.

Plus my Hard Drive… ARGHHH IT IS SO SLOW!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Problems
item.dc:creator: Zerego
item.description:
My Xbox 360 is still alive, and I’ve had it for about a year or so. It did get the RROD, but I slapped it, and it healed :3

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Problems
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
me and my friend run a small business repairing 360’s. If your 360 is loud as all hell now chases are that they did a 12v mod to your fans. This forces the fans to run at full speed at all times. It’s kinda excessive, but you cant argue with something that works. I prefer to just ass a second fan, remove the fan grill, and do a foil mod.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Problems
item.dc:creator: Timmeh2k9
item.description:
taxi_evil:

I mean I bought it retrofitted. £100 with new components, money’s tight so I can’t complain

Oh I see!

I have another 3 Xbox 360’s but they all have the RROD.

Read full topic

Timmeh2k9:

Sounds like your Xbox has been replaced with an older one, I’d watch out mate…

I mean I bought it retrofitted. £100 with new components, money’s tight so I can’t complain

item.title: Xbox 360 Problems
item.dc:creator: Suggestive
item.description:
I had one of the launch consoles at first and it packed in a year or so ago. Can’t remember. Sent it off and got it repaired without any problems.

Ended up trading it in for an Elite but I’m starting to fear for it already. Starting to make some very worrying noises. Doesn’t help that I’m hammering Mass Effect/Bad Company 2/L4D 2…I admit that I haven’t treated this one very well at all.

So yes, no doubt I’ll be updating this in a week or so with “OH GOD OH MAN OH GOD” or something along those lines.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Problems
item.dc:creator: Timmeh2k9
item.description:
taxi_evil:

I got my Xbox refurbished, so its been retrofitted to prevent RROD (or so they say…) Its loud as hell now, but I aint had a problem yet.

A mate of mine got an error that wasn’t covered by the warranty, so he wrapped it in hot towels until it red ringed. Red ring cover goes to three years or something

Sounds like your Xbox has been replaced with an older one, I’d watch out mate…

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Problems
item.dc:creator: Timmeh2k9
item.description:
SURPLUS_NiNjA:

they did, i am not kidding at all. It’s probably just a coincidence because the batteries fell off the controller and it still worked. But the band-aid idk, i also have a stone roster with a miniature bishop from a mini chess set on top of it that i keep in front of it at all time to ward off evil things. It’s retarded as hell but I haven’t gotten a rrod so i am not about to stop :retard:

Not that I want to burst your bubble but if you have had the RROD before then you WILL get it again. My Xbox was on an elevated surface, was clear from any other sources of heat and was only used in small bursts. Then one day, bam! You’ll be shipping your Xbox off to Germany or Texas or whatever (depends where you live really.)

I’d keep an eye on your Xbox if I were you mate…

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Problems
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
Timmeh2k9:

I have a feeling such events didn’t take place, did they Mr. Ninja man? :freeman:

they did, i am not kidding at all. It’s probably just a coincidence because the batteries fell off the controller and it still worked. But the band-aid idk, i also have a stone roster with a miniature bishop from a mini chess set on top of it that i keep in front of it at all time to ward off evil things. It’s retarded as hell but I haven’t gotten a rrod so i am not about to stop :retard:

item.title: Xbox 360 Problems
item.dc:creator: Timmeh2k9
item.description:
SURPLUS_NiNjA:

My Xbox 360 got the red ring of death, i put a band-aid on it and it stopped. Also my friend had a wired controller and it kept doing the disconnect message and he’d have to replug it in; so he decided that it thought it was wireless and needed new batteries, he taped batteries to it and it stopped disconnecting.

I have a feeling such events didn’t take place, did they Mr. Ninja man? :freeman:

Read full topic
